message.content:
Below is a worked‐through example of how to replicate the target “arched tower” using the dictionary blocks exactly as shown (no rotations).

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
1)  ANALYSIS OF THE MAIN TARGET IMAGE
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
• Total Block Count: 7  
  – 2 red “arch” blocks on the bottom  
  – 3 yellow rectangular “bar” blocks (one just above the arches, one in the middle, one on top)  
  – 2 red “ring” blocks stacked (with a yellow bar in between them) to form the circular opening

• Layer Description (bottom to top):  
  – Layer 1: Two red arches side by side forming the base.  
  – Layer 2: One yellow bar bridging across the top of the arches.  
  – Layer 3 & 4: Two red “ring” halves stacked with a yellow bar sandwiched between them, creating the circular hole in front.  
  – Layer 5: One yellow bar capping the structure at the top.

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
2)  SELECTING REQUIRED BLOCKS FROM THE DICTIONARY
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
You will need the following indices (re‐using them as many times as indicated):

• Arch Blocks (Red) – Index 1  
  – Use 2 of these to form the left and right arches at the bottom.  
  – (Index 1 has the correct “arch” on the bottom, facing front, and can be reused for both left and right.)

• Ring Blocks (Red) – Index 5  
  – Use 2 of these to create the circular opening.  
  – Placing one above the other (with no rotation) gives the front‐facing ring.

• Bar Blocks (Yellow) – Index 9  
  – Use 3 of these in a horizontal orientation (just as shown) for the three yellow layers.

Hence the required indices (with quantities) are:  
  – 1 × 2,  5 × 2,  9 × 3.

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
3)  STEP‑BY‑STEP ASSEMBLY ORDER
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
{
  Step1: Move block with index 1    (place first red arch at bottom left)  
  Step2: Move block with index 1    (place second red arch at bottom right)  
  Step3: Move block with index 9    (bridge arches with first yellow bar)  
  Step4: Move block with index 5    (place bottom half of the red ring)  
  Step5: Move block with index 9    (add second yellow bar in middle of ring)  
  Step6: Move block with index 5    (place top half of the red ring)  
  Step7: Move block with index 9    (cap everything with the final yellow bar)  
}

Following those steps (and indices) will reproduce the target tower exactly as shown.
